Introduction Mission and Vision Location Global Presence Services Innovation Culture Updates contact



The Walmart

LOGO

The Walmart logo is globally recognized and signifies Walmart's leadership in retail and its commitment to serving customers worldwide. It embodies Walmart's core values of affordability, accessibility, and community engagement.

  • Blue Color: The blue color in the Walmart logo represents trust, reliability, and professionalism. It reinforces Walmart's commitment to providing quality products and services.
  • Yellow Spark: The yellow spark symbolizes innovation, inspiration, and customer satisfaction. It reflects Walmart's dedication to offering value and creating a positive shopping experience.

    Mission and Vision

    To save people money so they can live better

    Location of Headquarters

    Bentonville, Arkansas, is a city in northwest Arkansas and is where Walmart was founded by Sam Walton in 1962.
    The headquarters complex includes office buildings, meeting spaces, and other facilities that support Walmart's operations globally.
    Walmart Home Office 702 SW 8th Street Bentonville, AR 72716-8611 United States

    Global presence

    Walmart's global footprint supports its retail operations and various business functions across continents, reflecting its role as one of the world's largest retailers.

    Products and services:

    Walmart's extensive product range and services cater to a wide range of consumer needs, combining physical retail with e-commerce and technological innovations to enhance customer experiences globally.
